title: Conyer Walks

images.title: David Anstiss / Reflections in Conyer Creek
images.caption: Reflections in Conyer Creek. Housing on the Creek, as viewed from Saxon shore Way footpath on other riverbank side.

images.title: Penny Mayes / Low tide in Conyer Creek
images.caption: Low tide in Conyer Creek. The creek meanders through the marsh and is only navigable for an hour and a half either side of high water. The thin poles are channel markers and it is plain from this picture that one needs to keep central between each pair to avoid running aground.

images.title: Penny Mayes / Drained marsh near Conyer
images.caption: Swale Marina Swale Marina, at the head of Conyer Creek, has 150 pontoon berths, accessible for one and a half hours either side of high water.

images.title: Penny Mayes / Swale Marina
images.caption: Saxon Shore Way on Sea Wall. The long distance path, heads from Sittingbourne to Conyer. Looking towards the Conyer Creek reaching the Swale.

images.title: David Anstiss / Saxon Shore Way on Sea Wall
images.caption: Saxon Shore Way on Sea Wall

images.title: Jacqui Sadler / The Swale and The Saxon Shore Way
images.caption: The Swale and The Saxon Shore Way

images.title: David Anstiss / Across Little Muston Nature Reserve
images.caption: cross Little Muston Nature Reserve. Near bridleway from Sittingbourne to Conyer.

images.title: Oast House Archive / Cheke's Court, Blacketts Road, Tonge, Kent
images.caption: Cheke's Court, Blacketts Road, Tonge, Kent Grade II listed

description: This little Kent based village has some nice waterside walks along the Conyer Creek and the Swale River. This circular walk from the village takes you east along the Saxon Shore Way and the Swale River to the Little Murston Nature Reserve near Sittingbourne. You can then return on country lanes and a section of the Swale Heritage Trail. The walk starts in the village and heads north west along the Conyer Creek to the Swale. You can then follow a waymarked footpath east to visit the Nature Reserve at Little Murston. There's a number of pretty pools and lots of wading wildlife to look out for here. The route then heads south to Tonger Corner and Cheke's Court where you pick up the Swale Heritage Trail. You can follow this long distance footpath east to Blacketts Cottages before returing to Conyer.
